title: Ticket #1280: Gram jobmanager version command doesn't work in most cases
description:
Gram's jobmanager version command doesn't work in most cases. The gram client library explicitly disables proxy delegation for this command. This causes the jobmanager to fail on start-up when it attempts to acquire a proxy (as it wants the delegated one). This causes the jobmanager to close the connection to the client without sending a reply. This results in a gram error 10 being returned to the caller. All versions of the jobmanager do this, so the client can't even determine if the jobmanager is GRAM2 or GRAM5.

If the server has a proxy for the mapped user in the default location in /tmp, the jobmanager is able to start up properly and either send back a valid reply (GRAM5) or an error 91 (GRAM2). This will normally not happen.

A simple fix would be to allow delegation of the proxy for the version command. The change would have to be made inside the gram client library. If a fix isn't available from Globus in time for 7.5.2, we should patch the version of Globus we build for Condor to include this change.

More information is available here: http://jira.globus.org/browse/GRAM-141
remarks:
2010-Apr-12 11:04:43 by jfrey:
If the version command returns gram error 10, the gridmanager assumes the server is GRAM5, which will often be a wrong assumption.

Update Globus external to 5.0.1, which fixes this problem. Change committed to V7_5_2-branch.
